channel.title: Avulsos by Penz - Whatsnew
channel.description: Whatsnew in Avulsos by Penz page.

item.title: News for 2010-04-11
item.description: My notes on how to debianize a git repository now available online in the Debianization with git-buildpackage article

item.title: News for 2010-08-15
item.description: The Hard drive occupation prediction with R article shows how to predict future free partition occupation by using a simple linear regression.

item.title: News for 2011-01-22
item.description: The second article on the "HD occupation" series, Hard drive occupation prediction with R - Part 2, shows us where the linear regression breaks (hint: real life), and uses Monte Carlo simulations to build a more robust method.

item.title: News for 2011-02-02
item.description: The Haskell eDSL Tutorial - Shared expenses explores the concept of domain-specific-language in Haskell by tackling a practical problem: sharing trip expenses.

item.title: News for 2011-02-16
item.description: After the Deadline is a English language checker used by Wordpress.com among others. I have built a command-line client for it: the atdtool.

item.title: News for 2011-06-23
item.description: The last article in the "HD occupation series", Hard drive occupation prediction with R - Part 3, explores how we can use historical data and Monte Carlo simulations to predict the range of possible values for HD occupation at any point in the future.

item.title: News for 2011-11-15
item.description: Google sheets is a great tool for collaboration. It's a spreadsheet where a team can simultaneously edit cells online, in a clear and consistent fashion. To ease the use of the product of this collaboration in other contexts, you can now use google-spreadsheet-csv to download and upload the CSV version of a sheet.

item.title: News for 2012-10-21
item.description: I always use watch to monitor the output of Unix processes and wait for events. I sometimes wonder about the history of outputs. Enters watchng, a python script that shows the output of a process along with the date-time, but only when this output changes between two consecutive runs.

item.title: News for 2013-03-17
item.description: I have built a new GPG key, and re-signed all my debian packages with it.

item.title: News for 2013-12-09
item.description: The Probabilistic bug hunting article shows us how to deal with software (or hardware, for that matter) bugs that do not have a deterministic behaviour.

item.title: News for 2015-10-04
item.description: The Create a Debian bootable live USB article shows my notes on how to create a rescue USB stick, or portable environment.

item.title: News for 2016-07-24
item.description: The new subdomain http://cv.lpenz.org/ now has my Curriculum Vitae, rendered from http://github.com/lpenz/cv with continuous deployment.

item.title: News for 2018-04-05
item.description: git-buildpackage commands changed, so the article Debianization with git-buildpackage had to be fixed and updated.

item.title: News for 2018-05-16
item.description: The Debian repository was removed from this domain, as I now keep all my packages in packagecloud. I have also removed my GPG public key, as that was used only for Debian package signing, and I have lost the private key :)

item.title: News for 2019-01-08
item.description: Wrote down some notes on Provisioning a Raspberry Pi using ansible. I'm currently using a hybrid Raspbian-Debian installation (Raspbianbian?)

item.title: News for 2019-06-25
item.description: Updated the Debian live USB article with Debian Stretch kernel version numbers, and with instructions on how to test with qemu.

item.title: News for 2019-07-07
item.description: I've written down some notes on how one can go about Creating a static nix channel that can be deployed with travis-ci to github pages. I've created one for myself here.

item.title: News for 2020-03-22
item.description: While looking up (once again) how to use LUKS, I figured I had some notes laying around. Finished them up in Creating an encrypted directory-in-a-file.

item.title: News for 2021-06-07
item.description: Creating a pmount-compatible encrypted USB drive has notes specific on how to use LUKS to encrypt removable media.

item.title: News for 2021-07-11
item.description: I've been standardizing my github repositories and found some common patterns, now documented in github project structure best practices. This is probably the one article that I'll be constantly updating as things change.

item.title: News for 2022-05-22
item.description: While looking at how to set up verified commits in github, I ended up with a scheme using a vaulted private master key and multiple private subkeys, with notations documenting their usage. I've written down some notes in Using GPG and signing git commits.

item.title: News for 2023-06-18
item.description: Debian Bookworm was just released. Time to update the environment (Dockerfile) that builds this website.

item.title: News for 2023-07-30
item.description: New article: Rust snippets.
